name: Titanium.UI.iOS.PreviewContext
summary: A PreviewContext provides options to configure the iOS 9 3D-Touch "Peek and Pop" feature.

events.name: peek
events.summary: Fired when the user peeks the preview. You can configure the preview
events.description:
You can configure the preview in this event before it is displayed. If the preview context is assigned to a normal view like a Titanium.UI.Button the preview property can be received here to change the content of it before displaying. If the preview context is assigned to a Titanium.UI.ListView, you can also receive the properties sectionIndex, itemIndex and itemId here to access item-specific data to display.

Note: Don't do asynchronous operations like HTTP requests here, since the preview will not wait for the operations to complete.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: The section index of the ListView to identify the selected section. Note: This property is only available if the preview context is assigned to a Titanium.UI.ListView.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: The item index of the ListView to identify the selected item. Note: This property is only available if the preview context is assigned to a Titanium.UI.ListView.

properties.name: itemId
properties.summary: The item ID bound to the list item that generated the event.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: pop
events.summary: Fired when the user pop the preview. You will most likely open a fullscreen window here.
events.description:
You can open a window here or update your current UI. If the preview context is assigned to a normal view like a Titanium.UI.Button the preview property can be received here to change the content of it before displaying. If the preview context is assigned to a Titanium.UI.ListView, you can also receive the properties sectionIndex, itemIndex and itemId here to access item-specific data to display.

Note: Don't do asynchronous operations like HTTP requests here, since the preview will not wait for the operations to complete.

properties.name: sectionIndex
properties.summary: The section index of the ListView to identify the selected section. Note: This property is only available if the preview context is assigned to a Titanium.UI.ListView.

properties.name: itemIndex
properties.summary: The item index of the ListView to identify the selected item. Note: This property is only available if the preview context is assigned to a Titanium.UI.ListView.

properties.name: itemId
properties.summary: The item ID bound to the list item that generated the event.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: actions
properties.summary: The preview actions and preview action groups.
properties.description: Provides an array with elements of the type Titanium.UI.iOS.PreviewAction and Titanium.UI.iOS.PreviewActionGroup. Both can be used together.

properties.name: contentHeight
properties.description: Specified the height of the preview which will be shown during "peeking".
properties.default: The available height of the screen.

properties.name: preview
properties.description: Provides the preview for "peeking". This view is independent from the window which can be openend after "popping" the preview to give you the ability to provide different layouts for the preview and the full window. If you want to adjust the preview inside the peek event, change the view assigned to this property.
